item.title: Putting back the benches, 3rd January
item.description:
Years ago there was 2 benches in East coast Gardens (Secret gardens) please can they be put back for those who would like to sit and enjoy the space again

item.title: Surface breaking up, 3rd January
item.description:
The surface on the road is breaking up on 2 sections that had previously been dug up and resurfaces. When heavy vehicles go over the bad surface and hit the pot holes or causes the nearby houses to shake it's so bad.

item.title: Very slippery icy pavement, 3rd January
item.description:
I was walking with my little baby in a pushchair along Albemarle Rd (from high street towards Westgate) and fell down with the pushchair when crossing Penrith Close. I was very careful but the pavement is not only icy but also a little bit slopping so it's very easy to lose control and sideslip. Luckly I was with my husband so he caught a pushchair and nothing happened to our baby but I badly hurt my knee so please be careful when walking Albemarle Rd. This section needs urgent deicing.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Albemarle Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eltham High Street, Well Hall, Greater London

item.title: Random people dumping, 3rd January
item.description:
There is an alleyway at the back of my house. People seem to be quite happy dumping their unwanted stuff. I have managed to get rid of a few things, but there is a lot more behind there. That doesn’t belong to me or my neighbours it’s not fair on us. I’ve seen people dump it. I’ve told them to stop doing it and they just say make me. I have a few cats that have trouble going through what people have chucked down at the back of our houses and to be honest I don’t really want to go to the Vet every time my cat gets stuck somewhere or hurts them selfs. I’m not the only one who has animals.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Glendower Crescent, Poverest, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Excessive litter, 3rd January
item.description:
Hello - this had been going on fur a very long Time but this week is just not ok - you sent some hackney councils staff who took pictures and a week later on nothing happened -they relieved the litter from the street but that’s it - also the white paint

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Princess May Road, Hackney, London

item.title: Very uneven pavements, 3rd January
item.description:
Very uneven pavements. Extremely difficult to walk due to ice on pavements. Many elderly/ disabled residents having great difficulty walking the pavements, due to weather conditions. Patchwork of repairs, making it extremely difficult to navigate the ice underneath. Couple of residents have experienced unpleasant walking conditions. Many reluctant to venture out side there residential property.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Frant Close, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Danger to road - caused my tyre to rip very badly, 3rd January
item.description:
The pothole and damage to the road has occurred many times on this road and not been fixed. This area has a parking space across the pavement which has caused my tyre to be ripped and £90 later getting a new tyre. I would like reimbursement for this as it is not fault that the council has decided to fix this inconvenience from pot hole. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Brixham Road, West Heath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Bin men have left large and heavy domestic waste containers where they shouldn’t be, 3rd January
item.description:
Contractors have left large and heavy domestic waste containers in a way which a) obstructs the pedestrian crossing, b) partially obstructs the driveway to the car park that serves the block of flats c) presents fly tippers with a way to easily and illegally dispose of their rubbish. This is not the first time that contractors have not put bins back where they should be on this development but normally it is the recycling wheelie bins which are easier to move. These bins they have left on this occasion are large and heavy and should not be moved by residents especially as they need to be lifted up a kerb to get them back where they belong. Please ask your contractors to return and complete their job to a satisfactory standard and instruct them to put containers back where they find them on this development. Thank you.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Downsbridge Road, Shortlands, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
